experiences.title: Junior IT Engineer
experiences.company: Chambre Vaudoise du Commerce et de l'Industrie (CVCI)
experiences.description: Junior IT engineer for nearly 100 employees. I administer M365, Entra ID, Azure, AD, the network and infrastructure. I back up the IT manager on priorities, licenses, ERP/CRM and projects. I independently manage a critical service for 30 employees and 15 sensitive applications. I provide 1st/2nd level support and ensure cybersecurity: access management, CVE monitoring, system hardening. I guarantee data compliance and succeed in annual audits. I collaborate with FER, the Confederation, social funds and IT providers for security and availability. I plan projects, improve processes and document solutions.
tasks: Manage user access and ensure their security.
Administer systems and network infrastructure.
Provide 1st and 2nd level technical support.
Supervise IT projects and back up the manager.
Independently manage a critical service for 30 employees and 15 applications.
Collaborate with FER, the Confederation, social funds and IT providers.
Use M365, Entra ID, Azure and AD to automate and ensure reliability.
Document, train and raise awareness of security best practices.
skills: Coordination with providers and external organizations

experiences.title: Software Developer (student)
experiences.description: At 42 Lausanne, I immersed myself in software development and problem solving. I acquired advanced programming skills and learned to collaborate in a team. I developed innovative solutions on real projects. This training strengthened my rigor, autonomy and adaptability. I put my knowledge into practice and understood the development cycles of professional quality projects.
tasks: Develop production-ready projects from A to Z.
Collaborate with other students in a team.
Solve complex problems and optimize code.
Apply design patterns and SOLID principles.
Work independently with strict deadlines.
Use Git for version control.
Participate in code reviews and pair programming.

experiences.title: Pharmacy Assistant
experiences.description: In pharmacy, I learned to manage stocks and use specialized digital tools. I complied with the sector's strict regulations. I developed quality customer service and worked methodically. I collaborated with the team to integrate innovations and improve logistics. I gained solid knowledge of pharmaceutical products and customer needs. I provide precise and personalized advice. I regularly attend training to stay up to date.
tasks: Advise customers and dispense medications.
Manage stocks and place orders.
Use ERP for medication traceability.
Comply with regulations and ensure compliance.
Optimize digital and logistical workflows.
Collaborate to integrate technological innovations.
Attend training to stay up to date.
